comment.body: Agree, this is the future. Zeronet is young, it will get better. I think @nofish has found the Holy Grail. Zeronet just needs time and more helpers, more refinement, more contributors. It also has to find it's identity as the place you can always go to when all the other centralized social media sites try to censor your free speech..üëçüòÄ

Even better would be the option to have all your post mirrored to a personal public or private zite linked to your ZeroMe. But I think Zeronet kind of already does that. Just click on the user's profile identity..üòÄ
It's turning out to be very important. @nofish: üëçüòÄ
Go to ZeroHello log out. Then log in with you other ID private key. Then go to ZeroMe. Click on visitor to get a new certificate. The go back to ZeroMe. Click on your updated ID. #Done :-)

You can run zeronet in multiuser mode. Just go to the plugin directory and rename disabled_multiuser to just multiuser. I don't know about two instances. Maybe just installing in a different directory. Backup, try it. Let us know..üòÄ
Not if you change the default listening port 43110. It's probably in a config file, or a command line argument. Try it..üòÄ
@Quantumworld: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1501#issuecomment-410767501
AI has come a long way from the early days of LISP..üòä

@Quantumworld: I don't think that will work unless you're in multi user mode. But try it.. Hold on, I just got what you're trying to do. Just activate multiuser mode. Then login with your browser. Then open an incognito tab and login as a different user. Then open a Tor Browser Bundle and login as another user etc. All at the same time..üòä

Yep, I've been at this tech stuff a long time. From the days of Kilby, and the first microchip. From the days when hacking got its name. When hackers were the good guys. The ones who fixed things, and wrote the utilities to make things easier for everyone.

Zeronet's a great program. I think it's the future, and will only get better. It's actually very user friendly now. But could use a lot more User customization. I think that will come with time.

The ability to maintain an internet presence without having to run a server. Nor depend on an ISP or a third party/turd party not arbitrarily whacking your account over censorship bullshit, is the Holy Grail..üòÄ

Zeronet gives you a place and a backup where friends and followers can always find you. A place where friends and followers can get updated, if one of the centralized services or an ISP goes down.

And Zeronet is the first such network to make all of this widely accessible to everyone..üëçüòÄ
Lisp..üëçüòä

I don't agree with Trump on everything. But I thought it was a great speech, and great American theater too..üëçüòÅ

Trump's a hard guy not to like on a personal level. Love him or hate him, homeboy is uniquely all American..üëçüòäüóΩüá∫üá∏

@Morpheussnake: Right, no censorship. But it's super easy to mute or block a spammer. Just click on their profile then mute. Poof!.. Gone girl. I'm guessing you're one of those **(((Hebrew Niggers)))** aka **(((Jews!)))**  :-)

I worry about my wolves and other creatures. I haven't seen the white one from home in a while. Usually I can stand on the edge of the forest, and see their eyes shining at me in the darkness and silence..üê∫üòê
It's **Debian** young grasshoppers. In combination with a good system restore or snapshot backup program. There are many for Linux, you have to do your research..üòÄ

I think in the future everyone will have a zeronet ID linked to their FakeNet social media presence. 

Just think about it. What other Internet connection gives you a social media presence that can't be arbitrarily censored or taken down by some malevolent third party, government or corporate oligarchy.

That's free and serverless. Open source, decentralized and multi-platform. That can be accessed through proxies or easily installed. Giving you nearly absolute control of your internet presence. Even when you're offline.

There's nothing really quite like Zeronet. There's Retroshare, Freenet, Tor, I2p, Bitcoin Etc. But nothing as simple and accessible as Zeronet for all users and technical levels.

The original Bitcoin client was like this. Everything you needed. In a nice, tight, deceptively simple looking and easy-to-use program..üëçüòÄ
@leftside: Clever..üëçüòÄ

@leftside: Virtualbox has been excellent in the past. it has a seamless mode. And it lets you access disk and partitions directly in raw mode. Just be careful, that's an advanced mode. It also allows you to take a snapshot before you update or change your configuration so you can easily go back. Use snapshots liberally. Saves time. üòÄ
@Deliriumgoddess6: You might like Puppy Linux. I do.  üê∂üòÄ
At least a few of you are paying attention, and seem to have more than a few working brain cells..üòÅ

No I don't. You're probably using Tor Browser Bundle, which doesn't seem to work for uploading pictures. Tor probably wants you to use a different browser for uploading pictures like Firefox. So they can allegedly snag a few pedophiles. The truth is, they want to track copyright bullshit. Watermarks, stenography Etc. It's always about the money. Losers..üëéüòê
For what it's worth, I think you should delete one. I've had this happen to me when Zeronet was running\posting slow. Sometimes it would warn that the PIC was a duplicate..üòÄ
